intro: Pedicularis wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or red, and its hairy, herbaceous stems. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
